svg.text:
The modulation actor modulates the input signal with the pseudo-noise code. Modulation1 outputs the modulated signal for user1. Modulation2 outputs the modulated signal for user2.
The FIR represents the multipath channel. In this case, FIR has 3 taps, meaning that the channel has 3 paths.
The Rake1 actor is the rake receiver for user1. The signals it receives include modulated signal from user1, from user2 and noise. The receiver collects user1's signal from different paths and filter out inteferences from user2 and the noise. This can be achieved when using pseudo-noise code as carrier. The output of Rake1 is the detected signal of user1. If the SINR (Signal to Inteference and Noise Ratio) is high enough, the output should be same as the input of user1.
